name: Hotel Mercure Muenchen Altstadt

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel 4 or 5 different times now and this hotel is is a hidden jewel. It is off on a side street and takes a little effort to find it, but it is perfectly located ~ 1 block from the city center main drag and offers easy walking distance to public transportation and all the sights & attraction in the city center.
reviews.title: Hidden Jewel - Perfect Location & Nice Amenities

reviews.text: Rooms are on the small side by US standards, but normally sized for European hotels. Room comes with amenities like free mini-bar stocked with coke, apple juice and club soda -- perfect after your walks around town. Wi-fi seems much more reliable now and is dirt cheap when compare to other European hotels (3 Euros/day). TV programming is unreliable still -- as they get some of their programming/channels via satellite where clear line of cite is required.
reviews.title: Best Location
If you need the hotel for one night and you are not planning to spend much time inside.
reviews.text: No irons in the rooms, but rooms and well decorated and comfortable, thought small as mentioned earlier. Breakfast buffet is typically included in hotel rate; and the breakfast is very decent. The freshly squeeze OJ (from a mechanical OJ squeezing machine) is a very nice thing in the morning.
Staff is very nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Ideal for shopping/sightseeing
The place to stay when exporing Münich
reviews.text: Overall, this is a great value and a great location.

reviews.title: not as promised...
reviews.text: I have booked this room at short notice for only one night. Unfortunately there was only one room left the "best" (most expensive at least) the top floor suite as they call it. While I was booking the room through Expedia it was promised things like an own Nespresso machine (which was not there), a minibar (which was a joke), friendly staff (whatever) and a hotel parking (you had to find one on your own). Next time I look twice booking a room at this price...

reviews.title: Good hotel
reviews.text: I was impressed by this hotel. The staff was extremely friendly, the room was small but comfortable, the AC worked very well, and the bed was nice. My room was extremely quiet. The location can't be beat. I will stay here again.
This hotel was in a great location. Within walking distance to Marienplatz and train stations. The rooms were clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reached Munich during the Oktoberfest, so the hotel rates were not ideal, but felt a great value in this hotel nonetheless.
reviews.title: Great Location and Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is superb, walking distance from Marienplatz, subway and tourist attractions. Several blocks to the Oktoberfest fair also.
reviews.title: Really good choice for excellent price

reviews.text: Recently stayed with a group at the Mecure Muenchen Altstadt and was pleased with the hotel. Very clean rooms, the rooms are a bit small. Clean bathrooms with nice modern fixtures and showers. Excellent breakfast, variety of items: eggs, sausage, cheeses, breads (croissants, toast, rolls), cereals, yogurt, wonderful jams/jellies. Fresh squeezed orange juice machine, cappuchino machine. The only negative thing is the front desk staff, they were not friendly and seemed put off if you had a question. They should put the ladies from the breakfast area at the front desk...the breakfast area staff was very friendly and happy to help out if you needed anything. The hotel location is perfect, easy walk to the Marienplatz.
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations

reviews.text: Small but cozy hotel is one of the very few located steps from the main market and Marienplatz. Modern, clean with great breakfast offering freshly squeezed orange juice (well, that is important for me). Being a frequent traveller to Munich I have stayed in many hotels indeed and I this is the one I like the most. It was not my first time here and certainly not the last one. Excellent value for money concerning the location and service!
reviews.title: Favourite hotel in Munich

reviews.text: we arrived the hotel in the night after hard trip from milano by car and when we make the check in the staff who is in the night shift made mistake by giving us twin room and when i informed him about his mistake he don't care by saying just move the bed and it will be double ???????? also he don't care about us when we pull our luggage and he don't offer trolley, actually this man should not work in front office because he don't know how to smile,finally the hotel location is good but we don't feel comfortable after the first impression from the staff.
reviews.title: bad night shift staff and good location

description: The non-smoking HOTEL Mercure Munich Altstadt is a fully air-conditioned facility in the heart of the Bavarian capital, just two minute’s walk to the famous Marienplatz. All 75 of our suites and rooms have modern furnishings with free Wi-Fi access to the Internet. Soft drinks as Welcome-Drinks from the mini-bar and SKY-Entertainment are free of charge. Your room is also equipped with a safe for your valuables. This 3 Star Superior Hotel is VDR certified with a number of nearby parking garages available (charges apply).Our lobby offers a beverage/coffee bar, an Internet terminal and a shoeshine machine for a polished appearance.House pets are also welcome for a small fee, and for those hectic business days we also offer a laundry service. Ask about costs. Our fax and copy service is of course free of charge.
